answerText: Gabriela Mistral [or Lucila Godoy Alcayaga][10] Sonnets of Death was inspired by the suicide of this railway worker who was a close friend of Mistral.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Dartmouth A Round 13 | 6 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Answer the following about a Nobel-winning poet, for 10 points each. [10] This poet claimed that "there is no godless art" and "beauty is virginal and is not to be found at carnival or fair" in "Decalogue of the Artist." Her other works include Sonnets of Death and Tenderness.
